message.p: High quality - Further research is very unlikely to change our confidence in the estimate of effect
Moderate quality - Further research is likely to have an important impact on our confidence in the estimate of effect and may change the estimate
Low quality - Further research is very likely to have an important impact on our confidence in the estimate of effect and is likely to change the estimate
Very low quality - Any estimate of effect is very uncertain
See methods for more detail.
The standardized mean difference (SMD) is: (difference in mean outcomes)/(standard deviation of mean outcome)

The 'standardization' allows pooling of different types of outcomes.
The Summary of Findings Table (SoF) is:

A product of the GRADE Working Group and is a distillation of the GRADE Evidence Profile. The SoF creates a transparent structure for asessing the quality of evidence and displaying the estimate of quality along with the projected impact of a medical intervention or test.
Heterogeneity of pooled results is qualified by the Cochrane handbook as:
'0% to 40%: might not be important'
'30% to 60%: may represent moderate heterogeneity'
'50% to 90%: may represent substantial heterogeneity'
'75% to 100%: considerable heterogeneity'
'Inconsistency' of results downgrades the quality of evidence per the GRADE Profile.
1. Only use letters, basic characters (:;,.-=), and digits. For example, use 'less than' rather than <.
2. To collaboratively edit with a colleague over a conference call, use https://kobra.io/ and set the file type to 'xml'.
3. To trouble shoot errors, save the file onto your computer as test.xml. Then open in Chrome, FireFox, or Safari to learn which line contains the error.
